Detailed Description

A geometry repeated on a regular XYZ grid.

The main reason for the introduction of the EGS_XYZRepeater geometry is convenience when defining this type of geometry in an input file, although some optimizations in the implementation of the various geometry methods has also been achieved. A EGS_XYZRepeater is a geometry where a base geometry is repeated times on a regular XYZ grid. It is defined using 

:start geometry:
    library = egs_ndgeometry
    type = EGS_XYZRepeater
    repeated geometry = g_name
    repeat x = xmin xmax Nx
    repeat y = ymin ymax Ny
    repeat z = zmin zmax Nz
    medium = m_name
:stop geometry:

where g_name is the name of a pre-existing geometry. The medium input is optional. If present, the space within xmin...xmax,ymin...ymax,zmin...zmax is filled with the nedium named m_name, otherwise with vacuum. If the repeated geometry has regions, then there will be regions in the geometry, with the space surrounding the repeated geometry having region index . The repeated geometry can be of any type and complexity, the only requirement is that it completely fits within the box about the origin, where =(xmax-xmin)/Nx, etc.

See repeated_geometry.geom geometry file for an example of EGS_XYZRepeater use.
